DOC.brief_summary: This study consist two study overlap cohort . One follow epidemiological study urinary incontinence , case control study low urinary tract dysfunction woman diabetes . Study One : Subjects study retrospective cohort 2100 middle-aged old woman large health maintenance organization participate Reproductive Risk Factor Incontinence Study Kaiser ( RRISK ) . The RRISK I study assembled retrospective cohort long-term female Kaiser Permanente member determine association specific childbirth event , hysterectomy , hormone use urinary incontinence later life . The study also provide descriptive information urinary incontinence type , age , ethnicity , severity age onset . Study Two : Women diabetes 30-70 % increase risk lower urinary tract dysfunction , include low urinary tract symptom , urinary incontinence , ultimately bladder cystopathy . This sudy investigate natural history , risk factor , possible mechanism low urinary tract dysfunction infection among woman type 2 diabetes compare woman without diabetes .
DOC.brief_title: ORWH : SCOR Sex Gender Factors Affecting Women 's Incontinence
DOC.criteria: Previous participation Reproductive Risk Factors Incontinence Study Kaiser .
